pullrequest.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

content.raw:
I reconfigured the joypad settings so D mode can work: [#!/osrf/subt/commits/c272a5bac1e47d8422696281a2dcdb4f011ea911](#!/osrf/subt/commits/c272a5bac1e47d8422696281a2dcdb4f011ea911)

As for the issue #1, I noticed that a light object in a sdf file does not appear if it is to be spawned by `spawn_model` or the “insert” option of the Gazebo. This problem does not appear at 9.1.1, but after this version. I will check more details, but appreciate any comments or advice.

**Update: **Apparently, when a model with a light object is being spawned, a message is not sent to `~/factory/light` topic in Gazebo.
content.html:
I reconfigured the joypad settings so D mode can work: #!/osrf/subt/commits/c272a5bac1e47d8422696281a2dcdb4f011ea911

As for the issue #1, I noticed that a light object in a sdf file does not appear if it is to be spawned by spawn_model or the “insert” option of the Gazebo. This problem does not appear at 9.1.1, but after this version. I will check more details, but appreciate any comments or advice.

Update: Apparently, when a model with a light object is being spawned, a message is not sent to ~/factory/light topic in Gazebo.

pull_request.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

update.description:
Sample deployment of Husky/Jackal team into a cave environment

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2224798273-pic.jpg)
‌

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2295761883-Peek%202018-07-31%2011-45.gif)
‌

`husky_team.launch` and `jackal_team.launch` spawn teams of Huskies and Jackals respectively, in addition to one Iris quadcopter. The designs of the lights and dispositions are just for demonstration and to be redesigned.

**URDF**

* Added `urdf/xacro` files for flashlight and LED models \(in `subt_gazebo`\)
* Added `husky_equipments.urdf.xacro`, `jackal_equipments.urdf.xacro`, `iris_equipments.urdf.xacro` defining how a robot holds the lights
* Added revised versions of `husky.urdf.xacro` and `jackal.urdf.xacro`, so as to include the files above and to deploy multiple robots.

**Updated subt\_example\_node**

It has the following features now.

* Teleop: listens to topics advertised by joy stick/keyboard teleop
* Communication: uses CommsClient to send a message to another robot. Both sender and receivers flash their center LED.
* Flashlights: publishes ROS messages to control its flashlights.
* Control of a robot: publishes ROS message to each robot `cmd_vel` topic
* Selection: while being selected by the teleop, it blinks its left and right LEDs.

**Teleop by the keyboard**

Type:  
 `rosrun subt_example teleop_twist_keyboard.py`

It is almost the same as the original teleop script, but it displays a list of robots and you can choose a robot to control by hitting the corresponding number keys \(1-9 and 0\). The keys `a` and `s` turn the lights on and off, respectively. The script loads a yaml file `config/robot_config.yaml` containing a list of robot names. When you hit a number key while pressing down a shift key, the currently selected robot sends a message to the robot with the corresponding number.

**Teleop by the \(logitech\) joy stick**

Config data is in `config/logitech_config.yaml`

* To move robots: hold the left button \(LB\) and use the left joy stick to go forward/backward and turn.
* To use the turbo mode: hold the right button \(RB\) and use the same joy stick.
* For Iris, use the right joy stick to move vertically \(z-axis\) and horizontally \(y-axis\).
* To turn the lights on/off: use the left trigger \(LT\) / right trigger \(RT\).
* To select the robot: press A, B, X, or Y button \(the key bindings are defined in `config/robot_config.yaml`\).
* To send a message: press an arrow key

**lava\_tube.world**

To make the environment to look more realistic \(and just for fun\)

* Removed the sun
* Added the color of the cave in model.sdf
update.title: Multiple Huskies/Jackals + Iris (in a dark lava tube)

pull_request.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

pullrequest.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

content.raw:
I was testing with Tetsuya and we have identified two main issues:

1. The robot lights associated to the flashlights are not loaded.
2. The teleoperation expects the keypad to be in `X` mode but usually we operate in `D` mode.

Based on some testing, it seems that some changes after Gazebo `9.1.1` are generating problem \(1\). I suggest to test before and after [this pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2871/attach-lights-to-links-cleanup-and/diff) in Gazebo for trying to find the issue.
content.html:
I was testing with Tetsuya and we have identified two main issues:

  1. The robot lights associated to the flashlights are not loaded.
  2. The teleoperation expects the keypad to be in X mode but usually we operate in D mode.

Based on some testing, it seems that some changes after Gazebo 9.1.1 are generating problem (1). I suggest to test before and after this pull request in Gazebo for trying to find the issue.

Sample deployment of Husky/Jackal team into a cave environment

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2224798273-pic.jpg)
‌

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2295761883-Peek%202018-07-31%2011-45.gif)
‌

`husky_team.launch` and `jackal_team.launch` spawn teams of Huskies and Jackals respectively, in addition to one Iris quadcopter. The designs of the lights and dispositions are just for demonstration and to be redesigned.

**URDF**

* Added `urdf/xacro` files for flashlight and LED models \(in `subt_gazebo`\)
* Added `husky_equipments.urdf.xacro`, `jackal_equipments.urdf.xacro`, `iris_equipments.urdf.xacro` defining how a robot holds the lights
* Added revised versions of `husky.urdf.xacro` and `jackal.urdf.xacro`, so as to include the files above and to deploy multiple robots.

**Updated subt\_example\_node**

It has the following features now.

* Teleop: listens to topics advertised by joy stick/keyboard teleop
* Communication: uses CommsClient to send a message to another robot. Both sender and receivers flash their center LED.
* Flashlights: publishes ROS messages to control its flashlights.
* Control of a robot: publishes ROS message to each robot `cmd_vel` topic
* Selection: while being selected by the teleop, it blinks its left and right LEDs.

**Teleop by the keyboard**

Type:  
 `rosrun subt_example teleop_twist_keyboard.py`

It is almost the same as the original teleop script, but it displays a list of robots and you can choose a robot to control by hitting the corresponding number keys \(1-9 and 0\). The keys `a` and `s` turn the lights on and off, respectively. The script loads a yaml file `config/robot_config.yaml` containing a list of robot names. When you hit a number key while pressing down a shift key, the currently selected robot sends a message to the robot with the corresponding number.

**Teleop by the \(logitech\) joy stick**

Config data is in `config/logitech_config.yaml`

* To move robots: hold the left button \(LB\) and use the left joy stick to go forward/backward and turn.
* To use the turbo mode: hold the right button \(RB\) and use the same joy stick.
* For Iris, use the right joy stick to move vertically \(z-axis\) and horizontally \(y-axis\).
* To turn the lights on/off: use the left trigger \(LT\) / right trigger \(RT\).
* To select the robot: press A, B, X, or Y button \(the key bindings are defined in `config/robot_config.yaml`\).
* To send a message: press an arrow key

**lava\_tube.world**

To make the environment to look more realistic \(and just for fun\)

* Removed the sun
* Added the color of the cave in model.sdf

* To turn the lights on/off: use the left trigger \(LT\) / right trigger \(RT\).
* To select the robot: press A, B, X, or Y button \(the key bindings are defined in `config/robot_config.yaml`\).

**lava\_tube.world**

To make the environment to look more realistic \(and just for fun\)

* Removed the sun
* Added the color of the cave in model.sdf

pull_request.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

update.description:
Sample deployment of Husky/Jackal team into a cave environment

**Update \(Jul 23, 2018\): RosLedPlugin \(PR#10\) was implemented so that lights are controllable. Hence, this PR should be reviewed after PR#10 is merged. Sorry for the inconvenience.**

‌

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3959234142-Screenshot%20from%202018-07-27%2018-52-37.png)
‌

`husky.launch` and `jackal.launch` spawn teams of Huskies and Jackals respectively, in addition to one Iris quadcopter. The designs of the lights and dispositions are just for demonstration and to be redesigned.

**URDF**

* Added `urdf/xacro` files for flashlight and LED models \(in `subt_gazebo`\)
* Added `husky_equipments.urdf.xacro`, `jackal_equipments.urdf.xacro`, `iris_equipments.urdf.xacro` defining how a robot holds the lights
* Added revised versions of `husky.urdf.xacro` and `jackal.urdf.xacro`, so as to include the files above and to deploy multiple robots.

‌

**Teleop by the keyboard**

Type:  
 `rosrun subt_example teleop_twist_keyboard.py`

It is almost the same as the original teleop script, but it displays a list of robots and you can choose a robot to control by hitting the corresponding number keys \(1-9 and 0\). The keys `a` and `s` turn the lights on and off, respectively. The script loads a yaml file `config/robot_config.yaml` containing a list of robot names.

**Teleop by the \(logitech\) joy stick**

Config data is in `config/logitech_config.yaml`

* To move robots: hold the left button \(LB\) and use the left joy stick to go forward/backward and turn.
* To use the turbo mode: hold the right button \(RB\) and use the same joy stick.
* For Iris, use the right joy stick to move vertically \(z-axis\) and horizontally \(y-axis\).
* To turn the lights on/off: use the left trigger \(LT\) / right trigger \(RT\).
* To select the robot: press A, B, X, or Y button \(the key bindings are defined in `config/robot_config.yaml`\).

**lava\_tube.world**

To make the environment to look more realistic \(and just for fun\)

* Removed the sun
* Added the color of the cave in model.sdf

pull_request.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

update.description:
Sample deployment of Husky/Jackal team into a cave environment

**Update \(Jul 23, 2018\): *RosLedPlugin \(PR#10\) was implemented so that lights are controllable. Hence, this PR should be reviewed after PR#10 is merged. Sorry for the inconvenience.***

**Update \(Jul 18, 2018\): teleop by a joy stick added**

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3591929607-Screenshot%20from%202018-07-13%2011-12-53.png)
`husky.launch` and `jackal.launch` spawn teams of Huskies and Jackals, respectively. The designs of the lights and dispositions are just for demonstration and all temporary.

**URDF**

* Added `urdf/xacro` files for flashlight and LED models \(in `subt_gazebo`\)
* Added `husky_equipments.urdf.xacro` and `jackal_equipments.urdf.xacro` defining how each robot holds the lights

Also, each robot needs to have its own topic and namespace to get commands, but the original files could not have these settings. So I added redefined urdf files

* `husky.urdf.xacro` and `jackal.urdf.xacro` defines anything else and includes the files above

I am planning to let users put parameters for plugins in the `*.equipments.urdf.xacro`.

**Teleop by the keyboard**

~~At the moment, only the keyboard works to control individual robots. ~~  
 Type:  
 `rosrun subt_example teleop_twist_keyboard.py`

It is almost the same as the original teleop script, but it displays a list of robots and you can choose a robot to control by hitting the corresponding number keys \(1-9 and 0\). The script loads a yaml file containing a list of robot names. ~~At this point, the yaml file is used only by the teleop, but it may be used for robot configuration in the future.~~

**Teleop by the \(logitech\) joy stick \(added on July 18, 2018\)**

Config data is in `config/logitech_config.yaml`

* To move the robot: hold the left trigger \(LT\) and use the left stick.
* To use the turbo mode: hold the right trigger \(RT\) and use the right stick.
* To select the robot: press A, B, or X button \(the key bindings are defined in `config/robot_list.yaml`\).

**lava\_tube.world**

To make the environment to look more realistic \(and just for fun\)

* Removed the sun
* Added the color of the cave in model.sdf
update.title: Multiple Huskies/Jackals (in a dark lava tube)

Also, each robot needs to have its own topic and namespace to get commands, but the original files could not have these settings. So I added redefined urdf files

* `husky.urdf.xacro` and `jackal.urdf.xacro` defines anything else and includes the files above

I am planning to let users put parameters for plugins in the `*.equipments.urdf.xacro`.

**Teleop**

At the moment, only the keyboard works to control individual robots.   
Type:  
`rosrun subt_example teleop_twist_keyboard.py`

It is almost the same as the original teleop script, but it displays a list of robots and you can choose a robot to control by hitting the corresponding number keys \(1-9 and 0\). The script loads a yaml file containing a list of robot names. At this point, the yaml file is used only by the teleop, but it may be used for robot configuration in the future.

**lava\_tube.world**

To make the environment to look more realistic \(and just for fun\)

* Removed the sun
* Added the color of the cave in model.sdf

‌
update.title: Multiple Huskies/Jackals (in a dark lava tube)
